title: Champs seen at worlds: A list

replies.body:
It's really interesting looking at this list, because it tells what the pros know is the strongest (in the highest level of play). 

**Champions deemed OP by the Boards**
It seems Garen is overhyped, or at least completely outclassed by Darius.
Darius is as bad as the community makes him out to be.
Fiora is like Master Yi or Fizz, a unfun champion that is viable.
Thresh is good but not the best as the boards make him out to be.
Vayne has weaknesses in higher play, _but is still strong. Not god-tier, but good._
_Lee Sin is back! #LC$BigPlays_
Mordekaiser numero uno huehuehuehue.

**Champions that are powerful according to this list
Not including the board's champions**
Lulu is really good.
_Rek'Sai the knock-up bot is back!_
_Gnar is appearing again! He's a furry ball of CC in this hard-engage meta so it has sense._
Elise is really good, probably because its a lot harder to throw, so a lead is more important.
Gangplank is still really good.
Braum is really good, even better than Thresh
Alistar is underhyped, and is even _better_ in pick rate with Thresh.
Azir is still good.
Sivir and Tristana are both pretty powerful.

(I do not have access to the ban list, so apologies if that ends up being useful for this.)
_New updates are in italics._

Uh, Thresh has been a pretty consistent pick in worlds.

I'm also bummed Janna got mega nerfed right before worlds /again/ :/

can't have Janna ruining all our LC$ Big Plays.
#strategicdiversity

#riothatesjanna
#jannaisactuallythemostnerfedchampionnotirelia

Janna has always been really strong, so saying riot hates her because they nerf her a lot is misleading at best.

THE REASON they nerf her a lot is because they do not want to destroy her. all her nerfs have been toning her down incrementally over the course of multiple seasons. they make a small adjustment, she remains strong, they make another adjustment. they obviously DO NOT want to olaf/khazix/kassadin her. i would be convinced they hated her if she had several massive nerfs in the same patch that make her unplayable followed by several token buffs.

Riot has no idea how to nerf Janna. She has always been strong, but the consistent nerfs to her have started to make her feel clunky and frustrating to play as. Note, I say this having well over 5,000 games played as Janna since season 1. And no, if Riot wanted to be fair about balancing supports, we would have seen significant changes to Thresh a LONG time ago. Riot likes supports who make plays, not deny them. Janna went months of her Q not working correctly (drastically reduced knock up) before Riot even acknowledged there was an issue. 

Janna will never be Olaffed, simply because of how her kit works. They'd have to completely remove her knock up q / knock back ult for that to happen. However, they certainly can make her /feel/ underwhelming. It's also pretty funny that they continually knock her AP ratios, when in competitive play, it's very rare Janna builds hardly /any/ ap. It's also very uncommon in solo / duoq. Many of Janna's nerfs have amounted to the balance team having no idea how to actually balance her and nerfing parts of her kit that are actually fine.

I'd also argue that AP Janna in particular has been gutted repeatedly beyond reason, especially during some of the preseasons, but that's a whole other spiel about how Riot hates supports going anywhere else but the support lane.

janna going elsewhere than support is fine in and of itself, but janna pressing Q once every 30 seconds to perfectly last hit an entire minion wave isn't fine... it just turns out that solo lane janna isn't particularly efficient if she can't have reliable waveclear. Her kit design creates a sort of lose-lose scenario for a solo lane champion :(

This was a big misconception about AP Janna, and I find it annoying that Morello was spreading this falsely. If you ever watched Zekent stream, you know this was a straight up lie. She could not do that without at least 4 points in Q and a decent amount of AP. That alone would have been fine, but they also nerfed the ratio on AP Janna's shield, her ult ap ratio, her w ap ratio and her Q ap ratio on both the quick cast AND a full charged cast by a considerable margin. There's absolutely no reason for that lol. She's ineffecient because Riot nerfed every aspect of AP Janna, not just her Q. 

The smart thing to do would have been to have Q do reduced damage to minions. Bam, solo lane Janna is balanced.

well i have to agree with that, but my comment was mostly refering to season 2 AP janna, that's a long time before her 'support update' and the following ratio nerfs and it's the last time i also ever saw solo lane janna be something popular

Season 2 solo lane ap janna was not played very often. Only a couple of people played it at high elo (e.g., Zekent). One of the reasons he got popular was because no one dared to play it haha, and it was interesting to watch something out of the meta.

 It was strong, but it was strong because of itemization, not because of Janna herself. You could build Heart of Gold, kage's, philo and even an avarice and have retarded gold income by sitting mid and pressing Q on waves with all the free AP you got from the item generated gold. This was what made AP Janna op, but luckily riot fixed the stacking on the gold generation icons and re-hauled that shit. 

 I can't tell you how many times I've been flamed for playing AP Janna mid since season 1. During season 2 I had a 60% win rate with her mid, which I think is pretty decent considering the number of games I've played with her. I was consistently flamed for it at least every other game, even at plat-diamond elo. Somewhere along the line Morello said AP Janna was ridiculous because she could clear waves with Q, but that was a half-truth, and it seems to have just stuck.
Which is funny cause now we have viktor who does the same thing with his laser.

Thresh has _never_ been weak. _Ever._

He has always been A-tier, which is probably why people think 
he's really really over-powered when he's just overpowered.
true but janna is highly picked also
Janna has a 0% pick / ban. The tornado nerf was pretty huge for competitive Janna.

"It seems Garen is overhyped, or at least completely outclassed by Darius."

Understatement of the year

I got shot down on the forums when this was just starting when I said up and down that Darius was what you needed to worry about compared to Garen. 

i was right naturally, because MetalGearTeemu is always right, but yeah, interested in seeing if we get more blackmage or if he was a one off to capitalize on lack of knowledge.

Then you consider that Garen has received several straight nerfs where Darius has only received general adjustments to his power (his net power is arguably the same, just rebalanced into different parts of his kit, with the first true nerf being on the PBE at the moment).
Sivir isn't that strong, but she's been a notoriously high-picked ADC for any hard-engage comp because she makes the job so easy.
Also the spell-shield makes her ludicrously safe against pick-comps.
And the healthy amount of psuedo-AoE damage she does in team fights.
Honestly she's just a good example of a healthy ADC with proper dangers, damage, and team interaction.  Huh.  Imagine an ADC with a healthy kit.

What makes Garen tough is that he can sustain like a monster.  Because he never needs to base, he can get an xp advantage over his lane opponent who must back when low or die.  Garen wins trades in an island style top lane very well, and that's what Solo queue gets, an island top lane.

In LCS sustain isn't as important because they don't do anything without doing it all the way.  Garen would not trade sustain, he would either all in against his opponent or he would be all in on.  Take away Garen's sustain and he is far weaker.

But top lane is an island when it's Dyrus.

Does that mean they'll have to ban Garen against TSM? :O

It most certainly was not an island.  lolol

In pro play you have so many lane swap tactics now that there are no islands.
How is Braum better than thresh according to the list??? He's 1-8, no matter how highly contested.
how can {{champion:41}}  be ban 4 times and pick 2 if you say hes been picked once at the top
Cause he was played in the mid lane 1 game, which he listed further below in the mid section.
Why is this so highly upvoted?

Because actually having this kind of data collection visible is actually *really* rare.  If you go to the Worlds site, there's a stats page, which lists everything you'd ever want to know... for *the players*.

In terms of a clear view of what champions have seen play, and how frequently, and where?  You have to page through every individual match and tally it yourself.

There's a lot of times where people go "Pro play's just the same champs in the same roles every time", and I think a lot of people are curious to have the actual data in a visible format.
Thanks so much for putting this together!  Great info.
Well, thank God they are nerfing Eve next patch. She is clearly out of control...

I find it interesting to see the diversity of champion selection in the different lane. Particularly for Mid Lane, the *only* champion picked more than once is Azir. There were 9 other champions picked once each.

I thought that was interesting too. Before worlds kicked off I was pretty convinced that mid-lane picks were gonna be very stale with very little diversity, but what I've learned is that it's the _most contested_ lane that's going to dominate the meta with the fewest picks. In other words, it's where the players feel the most power is located that determines what the meta is. 

Over the course of the entire season the "tank meta" developed because of jungle changes initially (nerfs to some assassin junglers and buffs or just the addition of good items for tanky junglers.) Jungle was the most contested lane for a while and the other lanes fell into a "safe pick" pattern of champions who complimented the junglers once that key role was picked. Then the juggernauts/Fiora & Gangplank rework totally forced the _important_ lane to be top, so top is suddenly the lane that has the most focus. Gangplank, and Darius are pick/ban Gnar is considered one of the most reliable counters to Darius, and he's still strong in his own right (despite having insane team synergy no matter who he's paired with) and Fiora is now a legit threat. I think Mordekaiser is getting banned because he changes the game so much, he's too much of an X factor and no pro team playing with everything on the line wants to take that much risk. Mordekaiser may not actually be a good pick, but teams are simply mutually agreeing to not take that risk because even the team using him doesn't know exactly what impact that has and variables, even when they may be in your favor, are hard to math and are therefore scary. 

Unfortunately, it's about reducing the game to the fewest variables, and creating a situation that the players are familiar with. If we know that X,Y and Z are fundamentally the most _impactful_ champions, and they also happen to rock paper scissors each other, then why allow any other letter into the mix? Personally I find this boring as hell, and that's why I tend to support teams who refuse to play that "established" rock paper scissors meta such as C9 with their Veigar pick (or Kha'Zix like Hai used during the gauntlet,) or pretty much any UOL game, especially back when Kikis was still on the team. Other picks are viable, but they are less "known" which means that even the teams who **_DO_** use these unconventional champs very well feel like they're too risky and won't pick them when something big is on the line. In the past Mid-lane was the lane considered most important, but now top lane can carry and recently had tons of power shifted into it, so that's where the focus is. This frees up mid lane to be more "random" so to speak since there's basically no such thing as a mid laner who can't carry, this makes mid lane exciting, but unfortunately the game is still stale in the same way, it's just where it's stale that changed.

I also think that Riot seems to be taking the stance that "flex picks" are bad for the game, hence nerfs to champs like Lulu, Annie, Fizz, and in the past Morgana, the pro scene seems to agree since Lulu is virtually permabanned, and Mordekaiser (who can now flex, even though he's best bot currently IMO) is also permabanned.

> Champions with 100% Pick/Ban
{{champion:82}}  (6 Bans)
Champions which have been banned, but not picked
{{champion:82}} (6 Bans)

Hey riot... you see a pattern here?
I swear you can gut Azir all you want and he will still be viable do to the nature of his kit.
That juggernaut rework -- what a failure. They really should've waited to do something so experimental until after worlds in the pre-season where we expect things to be way out of balance.
Yeah, I don' t know what they were thinking adding such a drastic change so close to World's.
Can someone find a way to get this pinned to the top of the boards? This information seems interesting, and I'm certain many others would like to see this.
I'm flattered.  That said, I don't think there's any form of Request Sticky for these boards.  But hey, if a Rioter decided to I certainly wouldn't object.
not 1 {{item:3710}} jungle played, maybe that's a sign its time to stop all the QQ

Well the pros do discuss that hai has been the only pro to use it competitively in their patch run downs.  I don't get why these people qq about it.  There are plenty of ways to take devourer jungles out of the match.  {{champion:67}}  not so much... :(
You need a lot of team organization to control their jg before 20 minutes. It's common in pro play but almost never happens in solo-queue.
In the 100x pick ban list, should it be 4 bans, 2 games or 4 games, 2 bans?
Oh, yes, you're right; I did end up accidentally mixing those up.  Fixed!
He's GOT A GUN!

>7x: {{champion:122}}  (5W 2L)
5x: {{champion:150}}  (1W 4L)  

this is interesting because they are picking Gnar to counter Darius or shut him down and yet Darius is still capable of winning despite this. Darius is too strong in Pro play and he is too strong in lower Elo, i think its time for a significant nerf that touches on why he is so successful despite being outmatched/outplayed (at low ELO we call this lack of skill) or being behind (so far this is what it always is at Pro play).  

The other interesting pick is Elise, not interesting as in surprising, interesting as in why is she always a popular pick in all Worlds i see... I think other then Lee Sin i have seen her the most in all the pro games ive watched! 12 games 2 junglers per game means a maximum of 24 different possible champions could have been played in this role, 7 of them have been Elise and 6 Rek'Sai to counter Elise, not to mention she was banned 5 times. That means more then 50% of the possible Junglers played were influenced by Elise (either directly or indirectly) and out of 12 games she has had influence in all of them since she was banned to keep her away from the other team.  

I guess this is nothing compared to Morde who is so broken OP right now the Pros want nothing to do with him.
i think you're missing the {{champion:96}} Bottom Carry.
Oh, yeah, somehow he got lost when I updated for today (I have to manually redo a large chunk of the post each time).  I'll fix that now, sorry!

The biggest surprise IMO

No {{champion:42}}  yet
